alert.note: Alert for Elk; Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 04 at 10:53PM CDT until May 08 at 4:52PM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Kansas, including the following counties, Elk and Greenwood. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1052 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing along Otter creek near Climax in southern Greenwood county. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eureka, Severy, Fall River, Climax, Eureka Airport, Piedmont, Fall River Lake and Fall River State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Do not drive into flooded areas or go around barricades. Nearly two feet of water will carry most vehicles away. Turn around, don`t drown. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
